definition: housewife (jocularly)/female housekeeper of a higher rank (old)/busybody

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A housekeeper of one of those fellows if you could pick it out of her.
sentences.chinese: 你可以去問問一位神父所僱用的管家婆。

sentences.english: This was Zillah, the stout housewife;
sentences.chinese: 這人是齊拉，健壯的管家婆。

definition: shrew/see also 河東獅吼|河东狮吼[He2 dong1 shi1 hou3]
young lady of the house/wife of the young master
young married woman/mistress/(fig.) punching bag/(old) child bride
an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
